perturbation.original_text: 2.1 For the term of this Agreement, Tripath appoints Distributor as a non-exclusive distributor for the Products in the Territory, subject to Tripath's direct sales activities under Section 4.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.1 For the term of this Agreement, Tripath appoints Vendor as a non-exclusive distributor for the Products in the Territory, subject to Tripath's direct sales activities under Section 4.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Distributor' to 'Vendor' creates confusion as to who exactly is appointed, since the rest of the document refers to 'Distributor'. It creates uncertainty about which entity holds the rights and responsibilities of the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: 10.2 For OEM Products, Tripath warrants that the Products will be free of manufacturing and workmanship defects for one year from the date of shipment by Distributor to a customer, or eighteen months from the date of shipment to Distributor, whichever is sooner.
perturbation.changed_text: 10.2 For OEM Products, Tripath warrants that the Goods will be free of manufacturing and workmanship defects for one year from the date of shipment by the Supplier to a customer, or eighteen months from the date of shipment to Distributor, whichever is sooner.
perturbation.explanation: Here, the term Products is swapped with Goods, and Distributor is swapped with Supplier. These changes introduce ambiguity as to whether these terms refer to the same entities and items, potentially leading to liability and warranty disputes.

perturbation.original_text: 11.1 Distributor will submit reports as may be reasonably requested by Tripath, including, without limitation, monthly reports of inventory on hand and sales relating to the Products. Sales data will include, without limitation, Product part number, quantity, resale price, special pricing, distributor invoice number, and customer name. Distributor will submit these reports electronically on a timely basis each month and in no case later than two weeks after the beginning of the month.
perturbation.changed_text: 11.1 Vendor will submit reports as may be reasonably requested by Tripath, including, without limitation, monthly reports of inventory on hand and sales relating to the Goods. Sales data will include, without limitation, Item part number, quantity, resale price, special pricing, vendor invoice number, and client name. Vendor will submit these reports electronically on a timely basis each month and in no case later than one week after the beginning of the month.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Distributor' to 'Vendor', 'Products' to 'Goods', 'Product' to 'Item', 'customer' to 'client', and 'two weeks' to 'one week' introduces significant ambiguity, creates uncertainty in the enforcement of reporting obligations, and causes a clear discrepancy with other sections.
